place.name: EAST LAMBROOK
place.gazetteerText: LAMBROOK (EAST), a chapelry in Kingsbury-Episcopi parish, Somerset; on the river Parrett, 2 miles W of Martock r. station, and 5½ NE of Ilminster. Post-town, Ilminster. Pop., 312. The manor belongs to the Dean and Chapter of Wells. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £175.* Patrons, the Dean and Chapter of Wells. The church is ancient; and consists of nave and chancel, with bell-turret. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
